content.description: This is a classic in the Chopping Block area.  The second route on the left after passing under the huge chockstone, it climbs great crystals on a gradually steepening face.  It reminds me of a shorter version of Baba Cool.  One of the best of its grade at Rushmore.

This is the first bolted route on the left after walking under the large chockstone.  Climbs up the face and then fades right to anchors at the top of Wisconson Beef.  It's best to have someone second this route to clean the draws.
content.protection: Bolts - ends at anchors on Wisconson Beef

content.description: This route is very thin at times plus steepens up to just past vertical for a couple of body lengths. There are multiple cruxes with the true business being the exit moves from the steep headwall near the top. A nice dosage of both thin balancy type moves combined with steeper big hold/big move climbing. Nice position with a great summit view.
content.protection: 7 Bolts & Bolted Anchors   The bolts lack washers and as an artifact some are spinners.
content.location: The route is the right most bolted line on the wall and is about 20' right of Wisconsin Beef.

content.description: Either scramble up and climb the bottom ridge, or take the direct crack to the pin at the bulge. Back up the pin and then saddle up and ride the spine

climbs.name: It Ain't the Meat, It's the Motion

content.description: Climb the flake to its end and gain the spine
content.location: This flake is 10ft L of Pin Route, near the entrance to the corridor

content.description:
Chimney up to the first bolt. Move up and grab the dike. Pinch dem crystals to the top.

 No anchors at the top, the best option is to lead up and belay your second from the chains on the other side and rap down from there. There will be some rope drag but not as much as if you try to pull the rope from inside the corridor.
content.location: Enter the corridor formed by Cleaver and Chopping Block. This is the bolted line just inside.

content.description: Cleaver is sandwiched in between Chopping Block and Meat Counter.  The giant chockstone that hangs in this area is held up on the left by Cleaver.  Although this rock isn't to large, it holds a few popular routes.  Wisconsin Beef is a good 5.10, and then there is also a good unnamed 5.9 to its left.
